text: Should your therapy session be outdoors? More therapists are trying it. - The Washington Post
fullText: A growing body of research shows that getting outside is good for mood and memory. Some therapists are bringing their practices outdoors to boost the benefits.

text: Whirlwind day of diplomacy as US holds talks on Iran and Ukraine in Geneva - CNN
fullText: US envoy Steve Witkoff and US President Donald Trump’s son-in-law Jared Kushner are meeting with both Iranian and Ukrainian officials today in separate meetings in Geneva. Follow here for the latest.

text: The Epstein files have brought a wave of resignations and investigations - The Washington Post
fullText: A number of prominent figures have stepped down or are facing investigations after their communications with Jeffrey Epstein and his former longtime companion, Ghislaine Maxwell, were released last month.

text: Simple Lifelong Habits Can Cut Your Alzheimer's Risk by 38%, Study Finds - ScienceAlert
fullText: A lifetime of engaging with language and the written word – including reading books, writing, and learning languages – could be one of the best ways to keep your mind sharp and delay or prevent dementia, according to a new study.

text: 2026 NFL franchise tag window opens today - NFL.com

text: ‘Jordan is next’: West Bank annexation signals ‘silent transfer’ - Al Jazeera

text: Lindsey Vonn returns to US after Winter Olympics crash - BBC
fullText: Lindsey Vonn is home in the United States after four operations on the broken leg she sustained at the Winter Olympics - but is yet to stand up nine days after the crash.
